bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, January 26, 1946

div1.p: Kean encloses a clipping of Lazear's obituary and thinks it may be of value to Hench.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, January 26, 1946
div1.opener:
2804 N STREET, N. W.
WASHINGTON 7, D. C.
Jan 26/1946
My dear Colonel Hench
div1.p:
Here is a clipping which
Mrs Kean found in an old
Envelope in cleaning out a closet
It was evidently published shortly
after Dr. Lazear's death in 1900.
There is nothing to indicate in
what publication it appeared.

The quotation is evidently from a letter
written by me to the Surgeon General.
In your extensive researches you have
probably seen the letter.

The clipping may be of value in case
you have not seen it.
